verses.roman:
yavane bhasma-sān nīte
bhagavān sātvatarṣabhaḥ
ātmānaṁ darśayām āsa
mucukundāya dhīmate

synonyms: yavane—after the barbarian; bhasma-sāt—into ashes; nīte—was turned; bhagavān—the Supreme Lord; sātvata—of the Sātvata clan; ṛṣabhaḥ—the greatest hero; ātmānam—Himself; darśayām āsa—revealed; mucukundāya—to Mucukunda; dhī-mate—the intelligent.
translation: After the Yavana was burnt to ashes, the Supreme Lord, chief of the Sātvatas, revealed Himself to the wise Mucukunda.
